cleaned_text: Approaches to Cancer Care and Research While cancer research is advancing with emerging technologies, conceptual foundations of Ayurveda and Yoga are being explored for the development of therapeutic strategies. An integrative approach involving AYUSH systems may offer cues to foster translational cancer research. There is a need for an integrative approach based on the crosstalk between researchers of diverse knowledge disciplines. This special issue of J-AIM calls for research articles from diverse domains including research methods, cancer biology, integrative oncology, interventions for improving the quality of life and survival of cancer patients, and outcomes of integrative treatment for various types of cancer. Guest editors: Dr. Julia T. Arnold, Special Volunteer; National Cancer Institute Office of Complementary and Alternative Medicine, Bethesda, MD 20892, USA Dr. Manohar Gundeti, Central Ayurveda Research Institute, Mumbai, India. Special issue information: The issue will consider various types of papers- experimental (e. g. in-vivo, in-vitro, in-silico), reviews, discussion kernels, clinical research, patient data (e. g. case series and case reports), reporting innovative initiatives, conference reports, thought leadership article. Manuscript submission information: Please submit your manuscript on or before the submission deadline of 30th June 2023. You are invited to submit your manuscript at any time before the submission deadline. The journal's submission platform (Editorial Manager®) is now available for receiving submissions to this Special Issue. Please refer to the Guide for Authors to prepare your manuscript, and select the article type of "VSI: Cancer and Ayurveda" when submitting your manuscript online.
